intro: Pleurocoronis laphamioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
